availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John A. Tribble (Nicholas County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Nicolas County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Father of Joseph A. Tribble. Married to Martha Tribble. Father of Joseph A. Tribble, S. W. Tribble, Mary J. Tribble. Farmer in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Nicolas County in 1860. Employed George A. Ham in Nicholas County in 1860. Farmer in Nicholas County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 186B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 469.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 4, p. 263.
Find A Grave, "John A. Tribble (December 8, 1832-August 30, 1878)," Memorial #184245726, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/184245726 (accessed January 27, 2020).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Nicholas County, KY, July 1863, p. 52, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
